name: substack_bulk_search
description: Search multiple topics on Substack in parallel using concurrent browser tabs. Use this instead of calling substack_search multiple times - it is faster and more efficient. Pass all queries as a single comma-separated string.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Comma-separated search queries (e.g. 'tech newsletter,finance writing,culture essays')

detailSteps.code: const results = []; const items = document.querySelectorAll('[class*="search-result"], [class*="post-preview"], article'); for (let i = 0; i < Math.min(items.length, 5); i++) { const el = items[i]; const titleEl = el.querySelector('h2, h3, [class*="title"]'); const authorEl = el.querySelector('[class*="author"] a, [class*="byline"] a'); const dateEl = el.querySelector('time, [class*="date"]'); const likesEl = el.querySelector('[class*="like"] span, [class*="heart"] span'); const linkEl = el.querySelector('a[href*="/p/"], a[href*=".substack.com"]'); results.push({ title: titleEl ? titleEl.textContent.trim() : '', author: authorEl ? authorEl.textContent.trim() : '', date: dateEl ? (dateEl.getAttribute('datetime') || dateEl.textContent.trim()) : '', likes: likesEl ? likesEl.textContent.trim() : '', url: linkEl ? linkEl.href : '' }); } return { query: decodeURIComponent(window.location.pathname.split('/search/')[1] || ''), result_count: results.length, results: results }
detailSteps.name: search_results
detailSteps.label: Extract results
